column5: I wanted to make this smitty more versitile. I wanted to add a seat and also have it in the hub with me to so all my stuff was still packed in a dry place.  Put the hub and auger to the back so there was no wieght in the front to drag down the front of the skis. Good call Terry.  Took the seat off the toon and the base just snaps on the lip of the tub.    Just turn the seat and it fits in the tub    Rod mounts, that I just slide on the tube to hold the rods. They slide on snug. Going to add those coiled liner cords and attach to the eye bolt and to the rod. Just encase.      Simple smitty that packs up quick and fits just nice in the truck.      Just need to paint it up.
looks good  Thanks bud. My only next project will to fabricate a tow bar. As we all know, you cant tow it with just the rope. Did you keep that attachment from your old flip?
ah....no   I dont think i did keep it it went with the hut i sold guess thats why they paid me so much...lol
Yer a pretty crafty feller der Brian. Looks good. I wish you lived closer, I could get you to make me all sorts of stuff. I could make ya rich hahaha
shhhhhhh....damn  ...he's going to make me start paying...lol

Yer a pretty crafty feller der Brian. Looks good. I wish you lived closer, I could get you to make me all sorts of stuff. I could make ya rich hahaha  shhhhhhh....damn  ...he's going to make me start paying...lol   Never cash exchanged. Always a barter guy here. Love my laker/ white fish boat outings.
That beats the plastic Pelican I pull behind me it's just one big tub , I like yours much better !!!!

Salt fish? Bottled moose? Mussels? Fresh cod fillets?? I have it all....even partridge berry jam me son!  Have a boat too!  NOW, if you only lived closer to you Shane. Drool. LOL  Thanks Porkpie and jds63.
This will keep you awake! Will it run on 18V? Just kidding lol. Good job B.

Looks great! I have a plastic tub sleigh that I pull when I walk out onto Simcoe. Definitely need to grab a pair of skis and rig something like this up for myself - thanks for the guidance! Sweet seat too, man!

A buddy of mine built a Smitty, not nearly as nice as your Brian, but what he did do, is put steel grate on sections along the lid, so he could put his portable heater in it and sit on it, in the cold. The Smitty was always warm and as everyone knows, a warm tush leads to a warm body. He never uses a hut. HH
the fit in the back of the truck is nifty
